column4: If I run sudo apt-get upgrade via ssh and disconnect before the operation finishes, will this stop the operation?
yes.   start it with screen, then detach the screen and exit
you mean start it ON the machine rather than remotely?
thats a better solution, but with screen you can do it remote.
what do you mean?
sudo apt-get install screen    Then, man screen
oh i thought you were talking about screen as in monitor
to be clear, I'm connected via ssh on Putty
would screen be installed on the ssh host machine or on the remote machine?
you install screen on the machine you want to upgrade.   sudo apt-get install screen       Then, man screen
okay
i probably should have done that before i did sudo apt-get upgrade huh?
yes....
=D live and learn!
also, please prefix replies with the name of the person you are replying to.
okay, sorry
aww, now i can see your replies much easier.  thanks
i'm in class so I don't know if the upgrade will finish before I have to shut down =P
How bad will that screw things up?
if you use screen, then detach the screen you can safely close your ssh connection.
Looks like I'm in the clear, upgrade just finished. Going to install screen and play around with it a bit. Thanks for the advice!
